content_html:
wikiHow:Language Projects

Currently, wikiHow exists in 18 languages, including English. Ideally, wikiHow should be freely available to people throughout the world. To accomplish this goal, we have been expanding wikiHow into multiple languages. Please help us make the dream of a multilingual wikiHow a reality!

EditLive wikiHow Sites

  • English
  • Español
  • Português
  • Italiano
  • Français
  • русский язык
  • Deutsch
  • 简体中文
  • Nederlands
  • Čeština
  • Bahasa Indonesia
  • 日本語
  • हिंदी
  • Polski
  • ภาษาไทย
  • العَرَبِيةُ
  • Tiếng Việt
  • 한국말
  • Türkçe

EditProject Definition

The wikiHow Language Project is just beginning to get organized. If you are interested in starting a wikiHow in your own language, add your name to a project page below and gather volunteers to make it happen!


If you know a language that is not currently listed, feel free to add that language to the list.


Use {{Language|your personal message}} to invite others to be members of a language project!


Note: Please keep the list alphabetized. Thank you

EditHow to Sign Up

  • Click on a link and sign up for a language.
  • Add a language to the list.

    • Read the Language Version Process.
    • Create a new page.
    • Copy and paste wikiHow:Language Project Template into the new page.
    • Add your name to the list.
    • Link that page from here.

  • For questions, email wiki@wikihow.com.
  • If you have successfully created a wikiHow in your language, the Developing wikiHows Project will be a useful resource for you.

EditCurrent Language Projects

  • Afrikaans
  • Albania (Shqip)
  • Algerian (الدارجة الجزائرية)
  • Amharic (አማርኛ)
  • Armenian
  • Arabic (عربي)
  • Assamese (অসমীয়া)
  • Azerbaijani (Azərbaycanca)
  • Belarussian (беларуская мова)
  • Bengali (বাংলা)

  • Bulgarian (български език)

  • Danish
  • Esperanto
  • Estonian
  • Evvochian (Eminough'tn)
  • Filipino (Tagalog)
  • Finnish (Suomi)
  • Irish (Gaeilge)

  • Gikuyu-Kikuyu
  • Greek
  • Gujarati (ગુજરાતી)
  • Haitian Creole
  • Hawaiian
  • Hebrew (עברית)
  • Hungarian
  • Igbo (Asụsụ Igbo)
  • Inuktitut (ᐃᓄᒃᑎᑐᑦ)
  • Kazakh (Қазақша)
  • Kiswahili
  • Khmer (ភាសា​ខ្មែរ) (Cambodian)
  • Kurdish (کوردی / Kurdî)
  • Kyrgyz (Кыргызча)
  • Latvian
  • Lithuanian

  • Malayalam ( മലയാളം )

  • Yiddish
  • Yoruba

title: wikiHow:Language Projects

wikiHow:Language Projects
Currently, wikiHow exists in 18 languages, including English. Ideally, wikiHow should be freely available to people throughout the world. To accomplish this goal, we have been expanding wikiHow into multiple languages. Please help us make the dream of a multilingual wikiHow a reality!

 
 

EditLive wikiHow Sites



English
Español
Português

русский язык

EditProject Definition


The wikiHow Language Project is just beginning to get organized. If you are interested in starting a wikiHow in your own language, add your name to a project page below and gather volunteers to make it happen!
If you know a language that is not currently listed, feel free to add that language to the list.
Use {{Language|your personal message}} to invite others to be members of a language project!
Note: Please keep the list alphabetized. Thank you


 
 

EditHow to Sign Up



Click on a link and sign up for a language.
Add a language to the list.
Read the Language Version Process.
Create a new page.
Copy and paste wikiHow:Language Project Template into the new page.
Add your name to the list.
Link that page from here.



For questions, email wiki@wikihow.com.
If you have successfully created a wikiHow in your language, the Developing wikiHows Project will be a useful resource for you.
